#1:\r\n\r\nThere are 2 independent portions/aspects/changes/whatever to this fix:\r\n\r\n1. Modify the 'Add New Term' and 'Quick Add New Term' actions to take into account the status of the termbase. Both of these actions have a Condition attribute, which disables the entries in the menu if no text is selected in the open document. We need to extend this behavior to also check for write access, and if no access, then disable.\r\n\r\nThis means implementing a CompoundCondition, which joins the 'old' selection check to the new Termbase.IsReadOnly check, and returns true if there is text selected, AND the user has write-access to termbase.\r\n\r\n2. Retrieve the read-only status of the default termbase (Found! It already exists in ActiveDocument.TermbaseProvider.ActiveTermbase; we need to check for a ton of nulls, but it's there). Check how this is reported for a single-termbase provider (file-based, if read-only is possible) and for a multi-termbase provider (LC). AFAIK, all (Quick) Add New Term operations happen in the default termbase, so write permissions on OTHER termbases should not matter.\r\n\r\n ","updateAuthor":{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/user?username=emacovei","name":"emacovei","key":"emacovei","emailAddress":"emacovei@sdl.com","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","24x24":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","16x16":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","32x32":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443"},"displayName":"Elizabeta Macovei","active":true,"timeZone":"Etc/GMT-1"},"created":"2019-04-23T07:08:20.892+0000","updated":"2019-04-25T15:00:00.112+0000"},{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/issue/450064/comment/649721","id":"649721","author":{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/user?username=emacovei","name":"emacovei","key":"emacovei","emailAddress":"emacovei@sdl.com","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","24x24":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","16x16":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","32x32":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443"},"displayName":"Elizabeta Macovei","active":true,"timeZone":"Etc/GMT-1"},"body":"EDIT: We're done. Save the changes. \r\n4) Perform \"Update from Reviewed Target File (Retrofit)\" batch task option against the same project. Ensure that \"Review retrofit results in the Alignment view before updating\" option is set to ON. \r\n5) Click OK on the prompt to open the alignment file. \r\n6) Refer to the following reviewed side segments: \r\n- Segment 1: where the whole segment content \"はじめに\" is replaced by another text \"初期設定\". \r\n- Segment 10: this contains one of the replaced phrase \"プリンタ\" (from ”写真プリンタ”) \r\n7) Click on Update SDLXLIFF File option. \r\n\r\nExpected Results \r\nSegment 1 and 10 are updated in the same way as presented in the alignment file. \r\n\r\nActual Results \r\nFor both segments, changes from the reviewed file are NOT reflected. \r\n- Segment 1: remains unchanged \r\n !image-2016-08-03-22-33-06-366.png|thumbnail! \r\n- Segment 10: \"写真プリンタ\" remains unchanged \r\n !image-2016-08-03-22-30-45-324.png|thumbnail! \r\n\r\nNOTE: \r\n- Segment 1 is not automatically paired (connected) in the alignment file. \r\n- All the other changes of \"写真プリンタ\" are updated except for segment 10, and this segment has 2 segments joined together in the alignment file. \r\n
